item.title: Exclusive - The Vetting - Obama Praised Private Equity When He Needed Cash
item.description: Exclusive - The Vetting - Obama Praised Private Equity When He Needed Cash http://t.co/RhKJzgcx
item.content:encoded: Exclusive - The Vetting - Obama Praised Private Equity When He Needed Cash http://t.co/RhKJzgcx President Barack Obama has attacked Gov. Mitt Romney's record as CEO of Bain Capital, even attacking private equity itself. But ten years ago, as he struggled to raise funds for his long-shot U.S. Senate campaign, then-State Senator Obama decided to embrace the private equity industry and its wealthy Chicago political donors. At one point, Obama even co-sponsored a resolution in the Illinois Senate calling calling private equity firms like Bain "the best opportunity for long-term economic vitality" and for "the creation of jobs." Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: breitbart.com

item.title: In Closing Its Platform, Twitter Risks Destroying Its Community
item.description: In Closing Its Platform, Twitter Risks Destroying Its Community http://t.co/zFgLxYD9
item.content:encoded: In Closing Its Platform, Twitter Risks Destroying Its Community http://t.co/zFgLxYD9 After attaining unlikely success as an open platform, Twitter is demanding that third-party apps show Twitter’s stream the way the company wants them to. “You need to be able to see expanded Tweets,” Product Manager Michael Sippey wrote in an announcement on Friday afternoon. He said those features make Twitter “more engaging and easier to use.” But if Twitter squeezes too hard on third-party developers, it risks damaging something more important to the company than any set of features: It risks destroying the culture that has grown up around it. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: readwriteweb.com

item.title: Joe Budden's Ex Tahiry To Replace Emily B On Love & Hip Hop
item.description: #NECOLEBITCHIE | Joe Budden’s Ex Tahiry To Replace Emily B On Love & Hip Hop http://t.co/LMTUadhh #FOLLOW > @HCP520
item.content:encoded: #NECOLEBITCHIE | Joe Budden’s Ex Tahiry To Replace Emily B On Love & Hip Hop http://t.co/LMTUadhh #FOLLOW > @HCP520 Love & Hip Hop may be visiting Atlanta for now, but VH1 is gearing up to bring the show back home to New York for a third season. And with two of their major cast members out of the picture (Chrissy and Emily B) producers are pulling out all the stops to keep viewers tuned in, including snagging model Tahiry Rose and her ex-boyfriend Joe Budden to appear on the show. Link - Trackbacks

item.content:encoded: Uber, an App That Summons a Car, Plans Cheaper Service http://t.co/Rz3qf9az Uber, a car service with a following among urbanites, is trying to expand its appeal to the less affluent by adding less luxurious cars. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: nytimes.com
